SEARCH

Class PrimeNumberMethodTest

java.lang.Object
PrimeNumberMethodTest
public class PrimeNumberMethodTest extends Object
JUnit test class for testing the isPrime method from PrimeNumberMethod. This class contains comprehensive test methods to verify the correctness of prime number detection for various input values including edge cases, small primes, large primes, composite numbers, and special cases.
Since:
2025-12-08
Version:
1.0
Author:
Christian Canales

  • Constructor Details

    • PrimeNumberMethodTest

      public PrimeNumberMethodTest()
      Default constructor for PrimeNumberMethodTest class. This constructor is used by JUnit to create test instances.

  • Method Details

    • setUpClass

      public static void setUpClass()
      Executes once before all tests. Prints header information to console.

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Executes before each test method. Prints which test is about to run.

    • tearDown

      public void tearDown()
      Executes after each test method. Prints completion message.

    • tearDownClass

      public static void tearDownClass()
      Executes once after all tests. Prints summary information.

    • testSmallPrimeNumbers

      public void testSmallPrimeNumbers()
      Tests the isPrime method with small prime numbers. Verifies that the method correctly identifies 2, 3, 5, and 7 as prime numbers. These are the first four prime numbers.

    • testLargePrimeNumbers

      public void testLargePrimeNumbers()
      Tests the isPrime method with larger prime numbers. Verifies that the method correctly identifies various larger prime numbers up to 97.

    • testCompositeNumbers

      public void testCompositeNumbers()
      Tests the isPrime method with composite numbers. Verifies that the method correctly identifies non-prime numbers (composite numbers) as false.

    • testEdgeCases

      public void testEdgeCases()
      Tests the isPrime method with edge cases. Verifies that the method correctly handles special cases like 0, 1, and negative numbers which are not prime by definition.

    • testPerfectSquares

      public void testPerfectSquares()
      Tests the isPrime method with perfect squares. Verifies that the method correctly identifies perfect squares (which are always composite except 1) as non-prime. Perfect squares have at least three factors.

    • testEvenNumbers

      public void testEvenNumbers()
      Tests the isPrime method with even numbers. Verifies that all even numbers (except 2) are correctly identified as non-prime. 2 is the only even prime number.

    • testConsecutiveNumbers

      public void testConsecutiveNumbers()
      Tests the isPrime method with consecutive numbers. Verifies the method correctly distinguishes between consecutive prime and non-prime numbers. This tests the accuracy of the algorithm with numbers close together.

    • testSemiPrimes

      public void testSemiPrimes()
      Tests the isPrime method with numbers that are products of two primes. These are semi-prime numbers which should not be identified as prime.
